title: Senior Software Engineer (physics simulation)
descriptionHeader: Building physics simulation models of blast movement
description: You will lead the architecture and development of physics simulation models used to predict various aspects of blast movement, including the trajectory of the blast, the resulting fragmentation and the vibration waves propagating through the ground. You will also be respons=ible for the optimization of the simulation models.
note: You don't need mining experience to excel in this role.
responsibilities: Design and deploy backend/frontend systems that handle real-time blast data, geological data, and sensor measurements
Architect, benchmark, tune, and deploy physics simulation models to predict blast movement, fragmentation, and vibration propagation
Build pre-processing pipelines to turn raw field data into structured inputs for physics simulations
Optimize simulation engines and data pipelines to handle large-scale, rapidly growing datasets from operating mines
Manage core infrastructure (databases, storage, monitoring, logging) both on-premises at mine sites and in public cloud environments
Drive edge-computing strategies for low-latency physics simulations and real-time blast analysis on the mines themselves
Benchmark performance of physics simulation models versus conventional blast prediction methods
Collaborate with engineers and field teams to deliver end-to-end solutions from concept to field validation and hand-off
After the deterministic simulation models are validated, you will be responsible for optimizing the models, most likely by using machine learning
competencies: Proven success designing and building models with high fidelity to real world processes
Computer graphics experience is a big plus

Skilled in multiple programming languages (Python, TypeScript, Golang, Rust, C++, C, etc.) and popular machine learning libraries (e.g. pyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow, etc.) , with strong architectural principles
Experience with SQL/NoSQL databases, real-time analytics, and data pipelines handling large, streaming telemetry
Deep knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), edge computing strategies, and event-driven architectures
Demonstrated ability to diagnose bottlenecks, optimize performance, and deliver reliable, high-traffic services in demanding or remote settings
Solid security mindset, including expertise in authentication, encryption, and compliance (e.g., SOC2, ISO 27001)
CUDA / GPU programming experience is a big plus
Experience working with large datasets and modelling complex spatial problems with machine learning is a big plus
Mathematics, Physics, or Geoscience background is a big plus
inThisRoleYouWill: Own a product vertical with the opportunity to build a team around yourself over time
Work directly with our internal and external customers to drive our roadmap
Get to build alongside the best engineers and mining operators in the world
Be given autonomy and virtually unlimited room to grow
Travel all over the world
thisMightBeAGoodFitIfYou: Have a bias to action, take pride in your work, and care more about getting to the right solution than being right
Have led critical projects or initiatives
Have extensive experience shipping modern, full-stack software
Are product-minded and user-driven
Have a strong first-principled way of thinking, and a strong interest in physics and mathematics
Are a previous or future founder — if you leave Watoga to start a company, we'll do everything to support you, including investing in you and introducing you to Watoga's investors
Are excited to work in a fast-paced environment with high stakes and quick iteration cycles
additionalRequirements: Must be willing to work from our headquarters in Montreal
Must be willing to work extended hours and weekends as needed

title: Senior Electrical Engineer
description: As a Senior Electrical Engineer at Watoga, you will design and implement sensors and systems to survey and gather data on production blast benches. You will also be responsible for the design and implementation of the sensors and systems that power and control our sensor platform.
note: You don't need mining or drilling experience to excel in this role.
responsibilities: Design electrical layouts and schematics for sensor platforms, including power distribution, controls, and instrumentation
Ensure proper data collection and calibration from sensors and systems
Specify and source electrical components (switchgear, VFDs, PLCs, sensors, cables) aligned with rig requirements
Develop wiring diagrams, harness routings, and cabinet layouts, ensuring maintainability and compliance
Coordinate with controls/software teams to integrate I/O points, safety circuits, and communication networks
Perform load calculations, short-circuit/arc flash analysis, and ensure systems meet relevant codes (NEC, NFPA)
Provide field support for commissioning, troubleshooting, and iterative improvements

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Intern
descriptionHeader: Building predictive modelling and automating / optimizing decision making
description: As a Machine Learning engineer intern working at Watoga you will lead the architecture and development of machine learning models used to predict the properties of the subsurface from the various sources of data collected during the operation and to automate / optimize decision making in the field based on new and historical data. Your responsibilities include model architecture, benchmarking, tuning, geological data interpretation, data pipeline creation and data-driven automation.
note: You don't need mining or drilling experience to excel in this role.
responsibilities: Design and deploy backend/frontend systems that handle real-time field data, geological data, and sensor data
Architect, benchmark, tune, and deploy machine learning models to predict the properties of the subsurface based on historical and operational data

Optimize microservices and data pipelines to handle large-scale, rapidly growing datasets from operating mines

Benchmark performance of machine learning models versus conventional methods
Collaborate with engineers and field teams to deliver end-to-end solutions from concept to field validation and hand-off
Build hybrid optimization models and machine learning to optimize blast design and blast patterns

Build hybrid geostatistical models to predict the properties of the subsurface from the various sources of data collected during the operation and to automate / optimize decision making in the field based on new and historical data

Skilled in multiple programming languages (Python, TypeScript, Golang, Rust, C++, C, etc.) and popular machine learning libraries (e.g. pyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow, etc.) , with strong architectural principles
